title: Crossing epigenetic frontiers: the intersection of novel histone modifications and diseases
affiliations: Department of Hematology, Shandong Provincial Hospital Affiliated to Shandong First Medical University, Jinan, Shandong 250021, China

background: Histone post-translational modifications (HPTMs) are crucial for epigenetic regulation and are increasingly implicated in various diseases, prompting research into novel HPTMs and their therapeutic potential.
hypotheses: Do novel histone modifications play significant roles in the development and progression of various diseases?
Can novel HPTM inhibitors be developed as effective therapeutic agents for multiple diseases?
What are the key biological functions of novel HPTMs in transcription, replication, DNA repair, and recombination?
How do novel HPTMs influence cellular metabolism and its association with disease pathogenesis?
major_findings: Nine novel histone modifications (lactylation, citrullination, crotonylation, succinylation, SUMOylation, propionylation, butyrylation, 2-hydroxyisobutyrylation, and 2-hydroxybutyrylation) were comprehensively reviewed.

These novel HPTMs are involved in various cellular processes, including transcription, replication, DNA repair, and metabolism, and their dysregulation is associated with the development and progression of various diseases.
Novel HPTM inhibitors targeting various targets and their emerging strategies in the treatment of multiple diseases were discussed.
Novel epigenetic research techniques and their applications in the field of novel HPTM research were briefly introduced.
